intro: Otidia ferulacea, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Otidia ferulacea produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are wind-pollinated.
